name: Salted Caramel Banana Bread
author: Rachel Heather Henderson
summary: This is a sweet-salty recipe for decadent banana bread with an unusual twist that is guaranteed to satisfy your sweet tooth. This bread is great served warm; toast in a toaster oven, if desired.
ingredients: ¼ cup packed light brown sugar
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray
Whisk flour, baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt together in a bowl
Beat 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup brown sugar together in a bowl using an electric mixer until light and fluffy
Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating just until combined
Beat bananas and 1 tablespoon vanilla extract into butter mixture
Gradually add flour mixture, beating on low speed, just until incorporated
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 to 55 minutes
Cool in the pan for 20 minutes
Run knife around edges of bread and transfer to a wire rack
Heat 1/4 cup brown sugar and 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil
Cook, stirring constantly with a whisk, until sugar is dissolved, about 1 minute
Stir cream into brown sugar mixture and remove saucepan from heat
Stir 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt into cream mixture until glaze is smooth
